intro: Cracca tenuis, commonly known as slender cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas. Cracca tenuis is generally hardy and adaptable, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
